**The Magic Mirror of Merlin** is the [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"). It is the prize for completing the [Knight quest](/wiki/Knight_quest "Knight quest"), and is [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") for [wishing](/wiki/Wishing "Wishing") purposes. Its base item type is a [mirror](/wiki/Mirror "Mirror").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Effects](#Effects)
  - [1.1 Double damage](#Double_damage)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Variants](#Variants)
  - [3.1 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [5 References](#References)

## Effects

When carried, the Magic Mirror of Merlin confers [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") and [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy"). In addition, Knights do double damage to their enemies with some wands and most spells.

When [applied](/wiki/Applied "Applied") or [wielded](/wiki/Wield "Wield"), the Mirror speaks to you and gives a random rumor - the rumor is true if the Mirror is blessed, false if cursed and either if uncursed. It shares this property with [The Master Key of Thievery](/wiki/The_Master_Key_of_Thievery "The Master Key of Thievery").

### Double damage

A Knight carrying the Magic Mirror of Merlin in open inventory deals double damage to monsters when zapping the following wands or spells:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- [wand of striking](/wiki/Wand_of_striking "Wand of striking"), spell of [force bolt](/wiki/Spellbook_of_force_bolt "Spellbook of force bolt")
- [wand of undead turning](/wiki/Wand_of_undead_turning "Wand of undead turning"), spell of [turn undead](/wiki/Spellbook_of_turn_undead "Spellbook of turn undead")
- spell of [sleep](/wiki/Spellbook_of_sleep "Spellbook of sleep") (0, doubled)
- spell of [drain life](/wiki/Spellbook_of_drain_life "Spellbook of drain life")
- spell of [magic missile](/wiki/Spellbook_of_magic_missile "Spellbook of magic missile")
- spell of [cone of cold](/wiki/Spellbook_of_cone_of_cold "Spellbook of cone of cold") (only if [unskilled or basic](/wiki/Skill "Skill"))
- spell of [fireball](/wiki/Spellbook_of_fireball "Spellbook of fireball") (only if unskilled or basic)
- spell of [finger of death](/wiki/Spellbook_of_finger_of_death "Spellbook of finger of death")

Other effects of these spells (such as the number of levels drained by drain life or the duration of sleep) are not changed.

## Strategy

The Magic Mirror of Merlin is a worthwhile choice for lawful non-Knights making an artifact wish due to the magic resistance and telepathy it provides. [The Sceptre of Might](/wiki/The_Sceptre_of_Might "The Sceptre of Might") is a comparable lawful artifact in terms of desirability, but only confers magic resistance when wielded; the Magic Mirror only needs to be carried, making it preferable in that regard.

Some players recommend making knights [spellcasters](/wiki/Spellcaster "Spellcaster") in anticipation of obtaining the Magic Mirror and using its double damage effect; [magic missile](/wiki/Magic_missile "Magic missile") does enormous damage (with an average of 112) when cast by a level thirty Knight with the Magic Mirror.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) However, a Knight's starting stats make this somewhat impractical to attempt until much later on.

## Variants

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), The Magic Mirror of Merlin's magic resistance has been removed and replaced with [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") and [half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage").

## Encyclopedia entry

This powerful mirror was created by Merlin, the druid, in ages past, when trees sang and rocks danced. It protects all who carry it from magic missiles, and gives them ESP.
